thread.title: Terps WR Will Ulmer to transfer
thread.title_full: Terps WR Will Ulmer to transfer

author: Daniel Gallen
title: Terps WR Will Ulmer to transfer
text:
var ssaUrl = ('https:' == document.location.protocol ? 'https://' : 'http://') + 'pixel.sitescout.com/iap/0ea84626951144d2';new Image().src = ssaUrl;"/> Tracking the Terps Terps WR Will Ulmer to transfer Loh on University of Maryland football coach situation 
In a meeting with The Baltimore Sun editorial board, University of Maryland, College Park President Wallace Loh talks about the firing of Randy Edsall and what the university will be looking for in a new football coach. (Kevin Richardson/Baltimore Sun) 
In a meeting with The Baltimore Sun editorial board, University of Maryland, College Park President Wallace Loh talks about the firing of Randy Edsall and what the university will be looking for in a new football coach. (Kevin Richardson/Baltimore Sun) Daniel Gallen Contact Reporter Maryland redshirt freshman WR Will Ulmer given his release to transfer. 
Maryland redshirt freshman wide receiver Will Ulmer has been given his release and will transfer, a team spokesman confirmed Wednesday afternoon. 
Ulmer tweeted he had received his release Wednesday morning. Maryland fired head coach Randy Edsall on Sunday. 
Ulmer was a former three-star recruit out of St. John's in Washington. He played quarterback in high school before switching to wide receiver with the Terps. Ulmer was an Under Armour All-American and Rivals ranked him as the No. 35 athlete in the Class of 2014. 
Regarded as one of the faster players on the team, Ulmer never appeared in a game this season. 
Ulmer also tweeted he's looking to make a decision on his new college by December. When he committed to Maryland in April 2013, he had a host of offers from other Big Ten, ACC, SEC and Pac-12 schools.
